server.motionRecorder
Class MotionRecorder

java.lang.Object
  server.motionRecorder.MotionRecorder

public class MotionRecorder
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
marc This recorder is the server part of our application. It can play and record video from connected client simultaniously. The recording is started automatically when a motion in the client video is detected. Thatfore it is required, that the 'motiondetector' plugin from https://github.com/codebrainz/motiondetector is installed on the running instance It records and plays at the moment only video and no sound, with the theora decoder/encoder and ogg de/muxer. Stopped once, the pipe cannot be set back to running due to timestamp problems in the pipe. Either call init() again or create a new pipe to restart it.

Constructor Detail

MotionRecorder

public MotionRecorder(int port,
                      java.lang.String roomName,
                      java.lang.String cameraName,
                      java.lang.String path)
The default constructor for this recorder. It will set the values of this auto-recording pipe. To initialize it use init() and after that run the recorder with run() It supports listeners that inform about pipeline changes like motion detected(aka recording started), bus errors, warnings etc.

Parameters:
port - the port on which the server should listen for the incoming
roomName - the name of the room where the camera is in
cameraName - the name of the camera in the given room
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given recording path is null or the port <1 or >99999

startRec

private void startRec(java.lang.String fileName)
Starts recording on the given filename. If the file is existent, it will overwrite it without asking! This method will not check the given ending. If the recorder is already recording, has this method no effect.

Parameters:
fileName - used to capture the data to
Throws:
{@link - java.lang.IllegalArgumentException} if the given filename is null.

stops the recording and the playing of the webcam video

run

public void run()
starts the recorder. This will only play video, but not capturing video
